posts.name: Pete Walters
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.77 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • Now you can tap on a name in the calls tab to view additional information instead of immediately starting a new call with that contact. There’s still a shortcut to quickly call someone back too, but whether or not you use it is entirely your call.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.76 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.77.0.1013-beta

67 new commits since 7.76.0.1005-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.77 [1]

  • Check for mediaTierCdnNumber not just mediaTierInfo to determine list media integrity check [2]

  • Check for expireStartDate of 0 not just null [3]

  • Fix & improve performance of registration ID check [4]

  • Adjust message padding [5]

  • Consolidate Support URLs into one place [6]

  • Update libsignal to v0.79.1 [7]

  • Update how registrationIds are handled during registration [8]

  • Serialize AppAttest redemption attempts [9]

  • Catch wrapped rate limit errors in BackupAttachmentUploadQueueRunner [10]

  • Increase backup upload/download parallelism [11]

  • Fix expected emission count in OWSProgressTest.testTwoLayers [12]

  • Reset DidDismissDownloadCompleteBanner when disabling optimize storage [13]

  • Animate backup settings progress bars [14]

  • Pass through HTTP 404 when fetching pre keys [15]

  • Avoid deadlock in BackupAuthCredentialManager [16]

  • New RemoteConfig ios.libsignal.chatRequestConnectionCheckTimeoutMillis […] [17]

  • Accept identity change updates from recipients merged into the local recipient [18]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.57.1 [19]

  • Use dedicated feature flag for Backup megaphones [20]

  • Populate "last Backup" details after a restore [21]

  • Set BackupPlan for real on linked devices [22]

  • Durably update BackupSettings when BackupExportJobRunner finishes [23]

  • Don't owsFail on failing to insert into FTS index during DB recovery [24]

  • Update upload row state back to not done when re-enqueuing [25]

  • Schedule locally sourced quote thumbnails for uploading [26]

  • Fix unable to set wallpaper on iOS 26. […] [27]

  • Wait to tear down when processing low-pri pushes [28]

  • Update size of the timestamp and unread messages counter in Chats. […] [29]

  • Remove UIFont.dynamicTypeBody2 - it's the same as subheadline. [30]

  • Update FaceID and Camera permissions strings [31]

  • Redesigned emoji category selection strip in reaction emoji picker. […] [32]

  • OWSChatConnection: groundwork for high-level libsignal request APIs [33]

  • Use base ChatConnectionManagerMock in AttachmentUploadManager tests [34]

  • Adopt libsignal's "typed API" for username lookup [35]

  • Allow canceling subs with pending donations, with an extra warning [36]

  • "Zero kB" ==> "0 kB" in backups progress bars [37]

  • Store, build, and render basic poll create messages [38]

  • Remove Theme.darkThemeTableCell2SelectedBackgroundColor2. […] [39]

  • Don't crash when deserializing SDS models w/ unrecognized enum-property rawValues [40]

  • Bump FeatureFlags to expose Backups to beta builds [41] (reverted by [46])

  • Handle Upload.Error when uploading the Backup proto file [42]

  • Decrease for size for unread indicator in Chats. […] [43]

  • Darker emoji category icons in reaction emoji picker when using "liquid glass". [44]

  • Rename: "Signal Secure Backups", "Recovery Key" [45]

  • Revert "Bump FeatureFlags to expose Backups to beta builds" [46] (reverts [41])

  • Suspend message processing for entire backup bgprocessingTask [47]

  • Try to do overnight backups at 3am [48]

  • Properly reschedule backup BGProcessingTask if cancelled [49]

  • Insert recipients when added to a group [50]

  • Ignore cancellation when stopping to suspend [51]

  • Remove OWSAccountIdFinder [52]

  • Fix caching for the most recent group fetch date [53]

  • Make BkpSubMgr/redeemSubscriptionIfNecessary await interrupted-and-resumed redemptions [54]

  • Expect cancellation errors when refreshing groups [55]

  • Add timeout when replying via notifications [56]

  • Polish for poll receive UI [57]

  • Validate local registrationIds match the server [58]

  • Stop catching and forwarding pre key errors [59]

  • Handle 429s & retry-after when sending messages [60]

  • Only sort displayed addresses for group invites [61]

  • Refresh GSEs before leaving group [62]

  • Ensure messageStatus is stable [63]

  • Update release notes [64]

  • Update translations [65]

  • Revert "Fix Xcode 26 builds on CI" [66]

  • Revert "Switch to Xcode 26.0" [67]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.76.0.1005-beta…7.77.0.1013-beta

Localization changes

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked:
UI bug, at least on iOS 26

image1125×2436 159 KB

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked:
@sashaweiss-signal Just to make sure I don’t hold you back, you don’t need me to test this build yet since the related fix is the same than in .76? (I’m not pressing you, I just want to make sure I don’t overlook anything)

EDIT: Actually, they told me 7.77 solves the issue! Thank you so much Sasha

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
the date/time of the last message in a conversation on the chats screen has become bigger than before, i think, not sure if intentional (ios 26 rc)

1125×534 63.7 KB

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.77.0/653ced269df90e6e6742c1aabbd169d2b52b96c8967471c0495fa4e61656f776.zip

posts.name: Jeffrey
posts.cooked:
updates-bot:

Update size of the timestamp and unread messages counter in Chats. […] [29]

@awaitlink this change?

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
yea looks like it, ty

was just going to say unread message indicator also seems bigger xD

don’t really mind the change, bigger font easier to read, just feels unusual for now

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Yeah, we’re making a number of minor UI changes as part of our iOS 26 readiness. Some of them aren’t iOS 26-specific, though, so you’ll see some things like this even before we start releasing with Xcode 26 (when you’ll see all the iOS 26 updates).

Please continue to report if you think they might be regressions, though!

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: That’s really great to hear. Could I ask you to collect one last set of debug logs from them, so I can hopefully learn more about what their issue ultimately was? That’ll help us inform how we make this more robust for the future.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Sorry about this. We’ve got changes that should improve this once we’re releasing external builds using Xcode 26.

New Version: 7.77.0.1017-beta

3 new commits since 7.77.0.1013-beta:

  • More permissively allow people to attempt database recovery [1]

  • Allow manually wiping the shared app container if DB unrecoverably corrupted [2]

  • Update translations [3]

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked:
This should be soon though, right? iOS 26 is released in a week.

Edit: GitHub already released their xcode 26 app 2d ago

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Unfortunately, we don’t plan to have day-one support. iOS 26 produced way more UI issues with existing components than we expected, and it’s taking us some time to get it production-ready. It’s coming, though!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.78 release

posts.cooked:
Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.78 release.
